org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.components.popups.dialogs

Interface ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogTaskHandler

  • Enclosing class:
    ProgressDialog

    public static interface ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogTaskHandler
    Classes implementing this object are supposed to manage the underlying tracked task.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortTask()
      Signal used to abort the underlying task.
      void onTaskFinish(ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogTaskResult result)
      Called when the underlying task is finished.
      void startTask(ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogResultHandler contextForTask)
      Signal used to start the underlying task.

    • Method Detail

      • startTask

        void startTask(ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogResultHandler contextForTask)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Signal used to start the underlying task.
        • Dialog is never created if an exception is thrown so you don't have to close it manually in such cases.
        Parameters:
        contextForTask - provides progress and status callbacks
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        java.lang.Exception

      • abortTask

        void abortTask()
        Signal used to abort the underlying task.
        • Dialog is closed automatically.
        • Feel free to throw exceptions.

      • onTaskFinish

        void onTaskFinish(ProgressDialog.IProgressDialogTaskResult result)
        Called when the underlying task is finished.
        • You only need to use the task's result to generate new GUI - everything else is taken care of for you.
        • Dialog is closed automatically.
        • Feel free to throw exceptions.
        This method is only called FROM THE TASK and as such, notifications will not work in it.
        Parameters:
        result - can be any custom-defined class implementing the interface
